operation_mode.label: Operation Mode
operation_mode.comment: If the test mode is selected the test PSPID is used and the test SHA passphrases.

pspid.label: Live PSPID
pspid.comment: The PSPID as given by the Barclaycard.

test_pspid.label: Test PSPID
test_pspid.comment: The test PSPID as given by the Barclaycard.

live_sha_passphrase_in.label: SHA-IN Passphrase
live_sha_passphrase_in.comment: Enter the live SHA-IN passphrase. This value must be identical to the one in the back-end of Barclaycard.

live_sha_passphrase_out.label: SHA-OUT Passphrase
live_sha_passphrase_out.comment: Enter the live SHA-OUT passphrase. This value must be identical to the one in the back-end of Barclaycard.

test_sha_passphrase_in.label: Test Account SHA-IN Passphrase
test_sha_passphrase_in.comment: Enter the test SHA-IN passphrase. This value must be identical to the one in the back-end of Barclaycard.

test_sha_passphrase_out.label: Test Account SHA-OUT Passphrase
test_sha_passphrase_out.comment: Enter the test SHA-OUT passphrase. This value must be identical to the one in the back-end of Barclaycard.

hash_method.label: Hash calculation method
hash_method.comment: Select the hash calculation method to use. This value must correspond with the selected value in the back-end of Barclaycard.

order_id_schema.label: Order prefix
order_id_schema.comment: Here you can insert an order prefix. The prefix allows you to change the order number that is transmitted to Barclaycard. The prefix must contain the tag {id}. It will then be replaced by the order number (e.g. name_{id}).

title.label: Payment Page Title
title.comment: Define here the title which is shown on the payment page. If no title is defined here the default one is used.

order_description_schema.label: Order Description
order_description_schema.comment: This parameter is sometimes transmitted to the acquirer (depending on the acquirer), in order to be shown on the account statements of the merchant or the customer. The prefix can contain the tag {id}. It will then be replaced by the order number (e.g. name {id}). (Payment Page only)

template.label: Dynamic Template
template.comment: With the Dynamic Template you can design the layout of the payment page yourself. For the option 'Own template' the URL to the template file must be entered into the following box.

template_url.label: Template URL for own template
template_url.comment: The URL indicated here is rendered as Template. For this you must select option 'Use own template'. The URL must point to an HTML page that contains the string '$$$PAYMENT ZONE$$$'. This part of the HTML file is replaced with the form for the credit card input.

shop_id.label: Shop ID
shop_id.comment: Here you can define a Shop ID. This is only necessary if you wish to operate several shops with one PSPID. In order to use this module, an additional module is required.

api_user_id.label: API Username
api_user_id.comment: You can create an API username in the back-end of Barclaycard. The API user is necessary for the direct communication between the shop and the service of Barclaycard.

alias_usage_message.label: Intended purpose of alias
alias_usage_message.comment: If the Alias Manager is used, the intended purpose is shown to the customer on the payment page. Through this the customer knows why his data is saved.

transaction_updates.label: Transaction Updates
transaction_updates.comment: When the store is not available (network outage, server failure or any other outage), when the feedback of Barclaycard is sent, then the transaction state is not updated. Hence no order confirmation e-mail is sent and the order is not in the paid state. By activating the transaction update, such transactions can be authorized later over direct link. To use this feature the update service must be activated and the API username and the API password must be set.

cancel_existing_orders.label: Cancel pending orders when out of stock
cancel_existing_orders.comment: If a product is in stock only once and the payment of the customer ordering this product fails or is aborted, it won't be available until the order is canceled (see timeout option below). Enable this setting to cancel the customer's pending orders when he returns to the cart page and a product is not available anymore. Be careful though: If you enable this option, there is a chance that payments are made with the corresponding order being already canceled.

wait_for_success.label: Wait On Success Page
wait_for_success.comment: In some cases the transaction requires a few seconds until it is successfully authorized. When this option is enabled the user is hold until the transaction reach the final state. If this is not the case in 30 seconds a message is shown to the customer, which explains the situation.

external_checkout_account_creation.label: External Checkout: Guest Checkout
external_checkout_account_creation.comment: When using an external checkout, the customer can either be asked to chose an option to authenticate (as guest, register or login) or he can always be checked out as guest. For the second option to work, guest checkout has to be enabled in magento.

recurring.label: Recurring Payments
recurring.comment: If you would like to use recurring payments, you need our magento module "Customweb Subscription". For further information go to sellxed.com.

show_image.label: Show the payment image
show_image.comment: Show the payment image on the checkout page

show_payment_id.label: Show the payment id
show_payment_id.comment: Show the payment id in the order information

Currency.label: Currency
Currency.comment: Allowed currencies for this payment method

use_base_currency.label: Use base currency
use_base_currency.comment: Send amounts to Barclaycard in base currency.

settlement.label: Invoice settlement
settlement.comment: Choose settlement after order in case you want an invoice to be created with your oder. The state of the invoice will set according to your capture status

invoice_send_email.label: Send invoice email
invoice_send_email.comment: Send the invoice email automatically after invoice creation.

capturing.label: Capturing
capturing.comment: Should the amount be captured automatically after the order (direct) or should the amount only be reserved (deferred)?

status_authorized.label: Authorized Status
status_authorized.comment: This status is set, when the payment was successfull and it is authorized.

status_uncertain.label: Uncertain Status
status_uncertain.comment: You can specify the order status for new orders that have an uncertain authorisation status.

status_captured.label: Captured Status
status_captured.comment: You can specify the order status for orders that are captured either directly after the order or manually in the backend.

status_success_after_uncertain.label: HTTP Status for Successful Payments
status_success_after_uncertain.comment: You can specify the order status for orders that are successful after being in a uncertain state. In order to use this setting, you will need to activate the http-request for status changes as outlined in the manual.

status_refused_after_uncertain.label: HTTP Status for Refused Payments
status_refused_after_uncertain.comment: You can specify the order status for orders that are refused after being in a uncertain state. In order to use this feature you will have to set up the http request for status changes as outlined in the manual.

refusing_threshold.label: Refused Transaction Threshold
refusing_threshold.comment: A typical pattern of a fraud transaction is a series of refused transaction before one of them is accepted. This setting defines the threshold after any following transaction is marked as uncertain. E.g. a threshold of three will mark any successful transaction after three refused transaction as uncertain.

three_d_secure_behavior.label: Non 3D Secure Behavior
three_d_secure_behavior.comment: Some cards are not enrolled for the 3D secure process and you may exclude some cards from performing a 3D secure authorization. This setting controls, what should happend with these transactions. This setting requires that the parameter 'CCCTY' is returned.

three_d_secure_country_list.label: Non 3D Secure Behavior Country List
three_d_secure_country_list.comment: The countries listed in this field are used to mark transaction as uncertain. The behavior depends on the setting above 'Non 3D Secure Behavior'. The country code is taken from the card. You need to make sure you return the parameter 'CCCTY'. As indicated by Barclaycard this value is only for 94% of the transaction correct. The list below must be a comma separated list of country codes. The codes must be in ISO 3166-2 format (e.g. DE,IT,FR).

country_check.label: Country Check
country_check.comment: The module can perform a check of the country code provided by the issuer of the card, the IP address country and the billing address country. In case they do not match, the transaction is marked as uncertain. This setting does not override any other rule for marking transaction as uncertain.

authorizationMethod.comment: Select the authorization method to use for processing this payment method.

alias_manager.comment: The alias manager allows the customer to select from a credit card previously stored. The sensitive data is stored by Barclaycard.

credit_card_brands.comment: In case hidden authorization is used, the brand of the credit card is detected by the card number and the card number is validated accordingly. This setting enables the restriction of the allowed brands.
